[SYNTAX]: Occasionally complex, winding sentence structures may impede immediate clarity.
[LEXICON]: Some archaic or less common vocabulary (e.g., "disconcerting conviction of unreality", "induce deliberately the 'Christmas feeling'") might challenge casual readers.

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from nostalgic description to philosophical questioning without clear transitional phrases.
[CLARITY]: The author's central argument ("Christmas has lost some of its magic") could be more directly stated earlier for clearer coherence.

[LEXICON]: Occasional use of less common vocabulary (e.g., "ebullition", "naïveté") might slow comprehension for some readers.
